comments:
When I try to synchronize a larger part of my project (or the whole one) I get 
the following exception in the log

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 VII 22, 2004 15:24:02.500
!MESSAGE Problems reported while synchronizing CVS Workspace. 0 of 1 resources 
were synchronized.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 VII 22, 2004 15:24:02.500
!MESSAGE An error occurred synchronizing /LifeSensor/Source/lib: The server 
reported an error: Too many open files
!STACK 1

reported an error: Too many open files

!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -10 VII 22, 2004 15:24:02.500
!MESSAGE The server reported an error: Too many open files
!SUBENTRY 3 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -10 VII 22, 2004 15:24:02.500
!MESSAGE The server did not provide any additional information.
!SESSION VII 22, 2004 16:08:27.343 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200406251208
java.version=1.4.2_05
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=bg_BG

This is a server problem that is surfaced by how the synchronize view tries to 
obtain the revisions of any incoming changes. One workaround is to increase 
the number of open files that your server allows. Here's one of the links I 
found using Google that explained how to do this:

  http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/info-cvs/2002-04/msg00652.html

We do have code that limits the number of status messages we retrieve at one 
time. However, the trace indicates that the error is happening at a different 
time (i.e. when fetching new directories). We should investigate.

I have some more info. This message could be related to the problem.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 2 -22 VII 22, 2004 17:43:38.187
!MESSAGE Unable to determine server version. Host '172.31.2.9' does not support 
the 'cvs version' command. Although most functionality works, use version 
1.11.1p1 or later for full support.

I tried increasing the file handles to 8000. It didn't make any difference. The 
project files plus directories count about 32000 files. Should I increase the 
handles above this number? It may consume too much memory?

Re: comment #2 - Yes, server version matters. What version are you using? Only 
1.11.1p1 and beyond are officially supported.

Re: comment #3 - As I mentioned, we have code that limits the numbers of files 
communicated at a time but it is not in effct on the code path from the 
exception. It is possible that the server version you are using has other 
issues. Please ensure that you are using a supported version. Please reopen if 
the version you are using is supported and we will investigate further.

traces.message: The server  reported an error: Too many open files
